column8: Position Objectives Human Resources (HR) Officer is generally assigned to support Thailand HR Manager to provide services to School Management Team and employees in all areas of HR and relevant tasks in all schools in Thailand for the achievement of efficient and qualified services for schools and employees. Responsibilities Talent Acquisition Provide coordination and assistance in the end-to-end recruitment process, from resume screening, shortlisting, interview coordination, reference checks, and offer letters, ensuring the process is effective and compliant. Review and track all applications that come through the Careers website. Advertise positions on school websites, local websites and with agencies for vacancies that arise within the School. Onboarding and Offboarding of Employees Coordinate with HR team to ensure smooth onboarding and offboarding for the employees Supporting managers in Onboarding process including arrange for onboarding plan Perform New Hire check-in and Exit Interview for employees Prepare and follow-up on the Probation Evaluation process. Support HR Manager to conduct new employee orientation and induction Compensation & Benefits administration Enroll and remove employees from insurance plans, Social Security and Provident Fund. HR Manager to support all data Compliance and Policy Responsible for the implementation, training and administration of HR policies, programs and processes, ensuring staff have access to up-to-date documents in a consistent and timely manner. Support HR Manager in disciplinary and compliance cases that may arise. Performance Management and Development Supporting with employee annual performance review and trainings & development, including Safeguarding Supporting HR Manager with workplace conflicts and grievances through effective mediation, and conducting investigations as necessary Employee Relations and Engagement Consulting with Managers to provide daily HR support Work closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale and increase productivity and retention Promoting Employee Engagement and support in Action Planning process Supporting with employee annual performance review and trainings & development, including Safeguarding Others Create, maintain and update employee files, data, and HR system Contribute to the on-going development of HR policies and programs. Perform other human resources and administrative duties as assigned by Human Resource and Administrative teams. Requirements Ideally 5 years or more experience in a generalist HR role. Diploma or degree in HR or related discipline. Sound working knowledge of Thailand employment laws and regulations Excellent in Communication and People skills Experience in Recruitment including Expat employee Highly motivated with an eye for detail and quality of work. Customer focus Confident in presentation skills Must be reliable and flexible, with ability to multitask and meet deadlines. Proven ability to build trust, credibility and forge effective working relationships at all levels in the organisation. Must have outstanding English proficiency, both spoken and written. Ability to work independently, as well as in a team, with people from multi-national and diverse backgrounds. Advanced Microsoft Office Suites including Word and Excel. Experience in a multi-national organisation is an advantage, especially with expats.

Jobtitle: Inside Sales Agent / Sales Coordinator / Sales Support
column8: #BeMore Do you aspire for a rewarding career that lets you do more and achieve more? Unleash your full potential at work with TDCX, an award-winning and fast-growing BPO company. Work with the world’s most loved brands and be with awesome, diverse people. Be home, belong, and start your journey to #BeMore! As an Inside Sales Agent, you will be working with our Lab Equipment & Devices Account to deliver #happier customer experience. As an Inside Sales Agent, your primary responsibility is to reach out to all known potential customers to verify the opportunity from which it can be converted to a sales funnel. In addition, you will need to identify unknown potential customers for the same purpose. You also will be working with analytical instruments, consumables, or services in a scientific laboratory. Top reasons to work with TDCX. Attractive remuneration, great perks, and performance incentives Comprehensive medical, insurance, or social security coverage World-class workspaces Engaging activities and recognition programs Strong learning and development plans for your career growth Positive culture for you to #BeMore at work Easy to locate area with direct access to public transport Flexible working arrangements Be coached and mentored by experts in your field Join a global company, winner of hundreds of industry awards What is your mission? Reach prospective customers through phone and email and conduct outbound prospecting calls. initially from lists provided by our client's sales/marketing teams to access business potential. Conduct outbound prospection calls for Prospects Lists collected from External Directory or conference, Profile and nurture customers from the call and eventually converting to Customers. Responsible for generating existing and/or new sales leads and business opportunities through outbound prospection calls, handle complex leads, qualified and nurture the leads to potential business opportunities for assigned territory. Represent our client’s products and services, develop comprehensive understanding to assigned accounts or assigned geographic, territories or industries to identify how our solutions can meet needs Develop strong customer relationship and satisfaction Manage existing accounts, drive organic growth, and develop new accounts and key performance indicators will include: Quota achievement Growth in existing accounts New business and customer’s experience Develop strong customer relationship and satisfaction. Sending out direct mails and following up over the phone until decision makers are reached or maximum number of contact attempts have been reached. Any other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned to you by the management from time to time, within your category of employment in the organization and for the effective implementation, maintenance, and continual improvement of the ISO9001 and ISO18295-1 Quality Management System of TDCX. Daily and Monthly Responsibilities: Maintain and build relationships with existing and new customers to ensure high level of service satisfaction and identification of potential new business opportunities. Identify sales prospects, outbound prospection calls to dark or new prospects, set appointments with customers virtually, make effective qualifying sales calls, and manage sales cycle to close new business in all service products offered. Possess in-depth product knowledge and be able to provide consultative advice to sales prospects to achieve sales objectives. Manage daily sales-oriented activities such as sales discussion, presentation, order bookings, and other documentation. Utilization of SAP CRM for updating the funnel and reporting Timely respond to calls/emails. Update CRM customer profiles during each outbound call to ensure the system reflects the current situation at customer accounts. Ensure any created funnel are forwarded to our client via the CRM system, as a sale opportunity at the account level in real time. Total number of outbound calls or prospection per day should be no less than 20 and each call has to be updated in the CRM as an interaction history. Who are we looking for? BA/BS degree in any field but graduates from Chemistry Science/Biotech or other related medical course will be preferred. 2-3 years of experience in sales, or sales administration. Prior experience in acquisition sales would be preferred. Strong understanding and experience in the digital advertising market. Previous experience in both traditional and digital advertising would be preferred. Outstanding written and oral communication skills. Previous direct sales experience would be preferred. Fluency in native languages of markets served. English ability a plus in non-English speaking markets, and required in mixed-language markets. Who is TDCX? TDCX (NYSE: TDCX) provides transformative digital CX solutions, enabling world-leading and disruptive brands to acquire new customers, build customer loyalty, and protect their online communities. TDCX helps clients, including many of the world’s best brands, achieve their customer experience aspirations by harnessing technology, human intelligence, and our global footprint. We serve clients in fintech, gaming, technology, home sharing and travel, digital advertising and social media, streaming, and e-commerce. Our expertise and strong footprint in Asia have made us a trusted partner for clients, particularly high-growth, new economy companies looking to tap the region’s growth potential. We pride ourselves on discovering and employing the best professionals to join us as we transform the outsourced CX industry. Our commitment to #BeMore for our people, our clients, and our community has led to us winning several hundreds of industry awards, including being one of the best companies to work for in Asia. From our first-rate workspaces, above-industry-average compensation packages, career opportunities, to our workplace perks, find out what else is in store when you embark on a career with TDCX.

Jobtitle: Learning Experience Designer
column8: Purpose of the Position The Learning Experience (LE) Designer is responsible for ideating, coordinating, and supporting Learning & Development activities with the Business Unit or function leads. LE designers play a critical role in the end-to-end learning process – learning needs identification, analysis, design, development, and transition to delivery and achieving the project's desired learning outcomes. Responsibilities 1. Identification of Learning Needs. Analyze business/service problems to evaluate the potential impact of learning experiences as a solution that aligns with the corporate’s goals. 2. Learner Analysis. Participate in functional and professional requirements to better understand learners' needs and context and synthesize the results into a summary and analysis document (input for the design workshop and shared with workshop participants). 3. Learning Experience Design. Organize and facilitate workshops to support the design of comprehensive and enduring learning experiences. Provide expertise and insights regarding learning innovation and analytics. Generate initial conceptual designs for learning experiences, leveraging established instructional theory in alignment with desired business outcomes. Utilize a wide array of resources, such as learning assets, knowledge management, certification, learning boards/collections, and social learning, to optimize the learning experience. Develop and implement prototyping and development strategies tailored to customers’ requirements and timelines. Ensure the quality, coherence, organization, and execution of learning designs, adhering to defined quality standards and desired business outcomes. Collaborate with the L&D team(s) in project kick-off meetings to comprehensively understand the client and project objectives. 4. Program Design & Iterative Development. Conduct a comprehensive assessment of learning designs to determine their ability to promote lasting learning outcomes. Determine the learning objectives for each learning experience component, aligning them with desired business outcomes, and ensure that the content appropriately matches the identified purposes. Foster high-quality, cohesive learning experiences across multiple asynchronous learning channels through iterative development and seamless transition to the delivery phase. Ensure robust governance practices are implemented to maintain quality standards within and across learning experiences. Collaborate with the Project Manager and customer’s requirements to devise adequate staffing and governance approaches. Work closely with the team to monitor the progress of the learning experience and cross-reference it to ensure a smooth transition to the delivery phase. Evaluate the quality of the learning experience(s) based on their ability to facilitate lasting learning outcomes and achieve desired business goals, establishing exit criteria for the transition to the delivery phase. 5. Transition to Delivery. Work with the related party to establish a transition schedule and activities in conjunction with the Strategic Delivery Planner. Contribute to and participate in project debrief reviews. Identify continuous improvement areas based on lessons learned; modify process steps as appropriate with input from the manager. 6. Relationship Management. Collaborate with team, peers, and Subject Matter Experts throughout the end-to-end learning process to ensure quality outcomes. Ensure risks and issues with timeline, scope, and budget are appropriately documented, reported, and mitigated. 7. Innovation and Analytics. Incorporate insights into learning experience designs. Identify potential learning analytics projects, innovation research opportunities, and learner data-gathering opportunities/research. Alongside the Learning Innovation Exchange team, help educate team members on the efficacy of new learning trends and be responsible for building out enablement materials for the efficient and effective implementation of those new trends. Job Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Organization Development, Human Resources Management or corporate communications or related field or experiences. At least 3 years experience in Training and Development, Training Roadmap and Internal Communications. Good interpersonal skills, creative thinking, self-motivated, result-driven, and service mind. Good computer skills in Microsoft Office (MS Excel, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, illustrator, and Photoshop) and multimedia programs. Able to communicate in English. Able to work well under pressure. Team players.
